text: —_—— REN OWN ~ DAY A big, almost empty schoolroom in a small American town in a timeless age between the late 1920's and the early 1930's. The SILENCE is underlined by the breathy TICK of a schoolroom clock and the SCRATCHING of two pens. We SEE TWO YOUNG BOYS sitting at their desks writing. Their names are WILL HALLOWAY and JIM NIGHTSHADE. will is as fair as Jim is dark. The only other person in the room is MISS FOLEY, the schoolmistress. She is about forty, very plain indeed, with a dress buttoning up to her neck and an expression of sadness. On the blackboard behind her, in copperplate handwriting, is the line that the boys have to write out as a punish=- ment: "We must not whisper to each other in class."

We SEE Will, his paper covered with the lines, writing out the last of them. Then we SEE Jim. He is drawing on an odd sheet of paper, a cruel caricature of Miss Foley, her beaky nose, her jutting chin. As Jim finishes drawing, he HEARS a step behind him and, opening the lid of his desk a erack, slid the drawing in.
Miss Foley has left her desk and is standing behind the boys.
Finished?
Yes, Miss Foley.
Then you may leave. Quietly. And let this be a lesson to the both of you. I will not have whispering.
(getting up) Thank you, Miss Foley. They CLATTER out of the room, gathering speed as they reach the door.

(as he goes) Sweet dreams, Miss Foley! They are gone. Miss Poley opens the lid of Jim's desk and looks down at the caricature of herself, her plain face set and expressionless. She looks up as she HEARS the door open o.s.
